Why Category-Specific PR Lists Work Better

Generic PR lists waste your time. Category-specific lists deliver results because:

  • Niche Alignment: Brands see you understand their market and audience.
  • Higher Success Rates: 73% of creators land deals when targeting their specific niche.
  • Better Content Fit: Your existing content already aligns with brand values.
  • Faster Responses: Brands prioritize creators who clearly fit their category.

Top Clothing & Fashion Brands for PR

Fashion brands prioritize style, aesthetic, and trend awareness. These brands actively seek creators for OOTDs, lookbooks, and seasonal campaigns.

  1. Princess Polly: Gen Z fashion powerhouse with massive ambassador program. Focus on trendy, colorful content. Tag @princesspolly.
  2. ASOS: Global retailer with established 'ASOS Insider' program. Showcase diverse styles, tag @asos.
  3. Levi's: Iconic denim brand focusing on sustainability. Highlight vintage styles, tag @levis.
  4. Gymshark: Fitness apparel leader with athlete network. Post workout content, tag @gymshark.
  5. Revolve: High-profile influencer trips and partnerships. Create luxury lifestyle content, tag @revolve.
  6. Lulus: Women's fashion with affiliate program. Showcase occasion wear, tag @lulus.
  7. Zara: Fast fashion with global reach. Focus on minimalist styles, tag @zara.
  8. H&M: Sustainable fashion initiatives. Highlight eco-friendly content, tag @hm.

"I got PR from Princess Polly, ASOS, and Revolve all in one month through Newcollab!"

- Emma L., Fashion Creator

Top Skincare & Beauty Brands for PR

Beauty brands value authentic reviews, tutorials, and 'Get Ready With Me' content. They prioritize creators who understand ingredients and can demonstrate products effectively. For a comprehensive list with direct application links, check out our complete guide to 15 beauty brands actively sending PR to micro-influencers in 2025.

  1. CeraVe: Dermatologist-developed, TikTok-famous brand. Focus on ingredient education, tag @cerave.
  2. The Ordinary: Science-backed, affordable skincare. Create ingredient breakdowns, tag @deciem.
  3. Kiehl's: Heritage brand with diverse demographics. Showcase luxury routines, tag @kiehls.
  4. Laneige: K-Beauty with strong social presence. Focus on hydration content, tag @laneige_us.
  5. Supergoop!: 'Sunshine Crew' education program. Create sun safety content, tag @supergoop.
  6. Glossier: Minimalist beauty aesthetic. Showcase natural looks, tag @glossier.
  7. Fenty Beauty: Inclusive makeup for all skin tones. Highlight diversity, tag @fentybeauty.
  8. Drunk Elephant: Clean beauty with cult following. Focus on skin health, tag @drunk_elephant.

Top Food & Beverage Brands for PR

Food brands partner with creators for recipe development, taste tests, and lifestyle integrations. They value authentic cooking content and genuine product reviews.

  1. HelloFresh: Meal kit service with massive creator program. Create cooking tutorials, tag @hellofresh.
  2. Athletic Greens (AG1): Wellness supplement with health focus. Showcase morning routines, tag @athleticgreens.
  3. Oatly: Oat milk with distinct personality. Create sustainable content, tag @oatly.
  4. RXBAR: 'No B.S.' protein bars for fitness creators. Showcase clean eating, tag @rxbar.
  5. G FUEL: Gaming energy drink with streamer network. Create gaming content, tag @gfuelenergy.
  6. Blue Apron: Meal kit service for food bloggers. Post cooking tutorials, tag @blueapron.
  7. La Croix: Sparkling water with lifestyle focus. Use #LaCroixlove, tag @lacroixwater.
  8. Starbucks: Coffee brand with seasonal campaigns. Create coffee content, tag @starbucks.

"As a food blogger, I never knew how to find sponsors. On Newcollab, I listed my 'Healthy Meal Prep' series and got bids from HelloFresh and Blue Apron!"

- Alex D., Food Creator

Category-Specific Pitching Strategies

Each category requires a tailored approach to maximize your success rate:

Fashion & Clothing

  • Visual Portfolio: Showcase your style evolution and aesthetic consistency.
  • Trend Awareness: Demonstrate knowledge of current fashion trends.
  • Diverse Styling: Show ability to style pieces in multiple ways.

Skincare & Beauty

  • Ingredient Knowledge: Understand and explain product ingredients.
  • Before/After Content: Showcase product effectiveness with results.
  • Routine Integration: Demonstrate how products fit into daily routines.

Food & Beverage

  • Recipe Development: Create original recipes using brand products.
  • Authentic Reviews: Provide honest, detailed product feedback.
  • Lifestyle Integration: Show products in natural, everyday settings.

How to Create Category-Specific Media Kits

Your media kit should highlight your expertise in your specific category:

  • Category Stats: Include engagement rates for your niche content.
  • Content Examples: Showcase your best work in that category.
  • Audience Demographics: Highlight how your audience aligns with brand targets.
  • Previous Collaborations: Include relevant brand partnerships.

Common Category-Specific Mistakes to Avoid

Don't make these category-specific mistakes:

  • Generic Content: Avoid one-size-fits-all approaches across categories.
  • Wrong Timing: Fashion brands want seasonal content, food brands want fresh ingredients.
  • Ignoring Brand Values: Research each brand's mission and align your content accordingly.
  • Poor Quality: Each category has specific quality standards (lighting for beauty, styling for fashion).

Conclusion: Master Your Category, Master Your Success

faq.question: Do I need a different media kit for each category?
faq.answer: Not necessarily a different kit, but you should tailor it. If you're pitching a skincare brand, make sure your example content and stats highlight your skincare posts. A fashion brand will want to see your lookbook examples.

faq.question: What if my niche isn't on this list?
faq.answer: This is just a starting point! Categories like Tech, Gaming, and Travel are also huge. The best strategy for any niche is to post your content ideas on a marketplace like Newcollab, where brands from all categories are actively looking for talent.

faq.question: Do food & beverage brands send PR like beauty brands?
faq.answer: Yes, but in a different way. It often comes as product vouchers or a full box of products for you to use in a recipe or taste-test video. The goal is the same: to get an authentic review and create user-generated content.

faq.question: How do I pitch fashion brands vs beauty brands?
faq.answer: Fashion brands want to see your style evolution and aesthetic consistency. Beauty brands value ingredient knowledge and before/after results. Tailor your pitch to show understanding of each category's unique requirements.

faq.question: Which category has the highest earning potential?
faq.answer: Fashion typically offers the highest rates ($200-$800), followed by beauty ($150-$600), then food ($100-$500). However, success depends more on your engagement and content quality than the category itself.
